content:
From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>

Dear Isabelle users,

there is a lot of excitement and publicity around VSCode, and I have spent a
lot of time on Isabelle/VSCode recently. So this is more a question than a
statement: What is the state of Isabelle/VSCode in Isabelle2025-1?

There has been no feedback so far. This is an opportunity.

(My own excitement about VSCode was very positive in the early years, but has
dropped below zero now: the technology behind it is very poor, causing tons of
problems that are not strictly necessary.)

Makarius

From: Kevin Kappelmann <cl-isabelle-users@lists.cam.ac.uk>

No issues from my side regarding the current state. Usability and
stability improved a lot since the Isabelle2025 release, thanks!

Here are 2 things that would further improve my experience:

  • Something like the theories panel from jEdit (so that I can see build
    progress & failures)

  • General active markup support. E.g. when I hit the tracing limit
    message ("Tracing paused. Stop, or continue with next 100, 1000, 10000
    messages?"), I cannot click it to see more messages.

Best wishes,

Kevin
